review: I have either a Roku or an Amazon Fire TV or TV stick in/on every TV in the house.  I like the Plex menu best on the Roku but for the money, I love the Amazon Fire TV Stick.  This item is fairly idiot proof and doesn't require cable clutter.  I have seen reviews where people have to remove their Fire Stick to reboot it between uses, if that's the case I would call Amazon and send it back because it sounds like you have a bad one.  Amazon's support is excellent.Aside from just the sheer stupid simplicity of setting up the device, the wide array of additional apps is another big draw for me.  I have the usual streaming suspects but have just discovered other gems like Crackle (Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee) and of course Ted Talks.Did I mention the lack of cable clutter?  Oh, and if and when you lose your remote your smartphone can be used as your remote.  Smart, very smart.  No cable clutter!
author: Amazon Customer "n_eng"
